required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy Evaluation of Triple up® Collagen Drink on Skin Condition
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy Evaluation of Triple up® Collagen Drink on Skin Condition

brief_summary.textblock: To assess Triple up® Collagen Drink on skin condition improvement

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin moisture at 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Corneometer® CM825 was utilized to measure skin moisture. Units: arbitrary Corneometer® units 0-120

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin elasticity at 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Cutometer® dual MPA 580 was utilized to measure skin elasticity (parameter R2). Units: μm penetration depth into the probe opening, expressed as curves

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin wrinkles at 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: VISIA Complexion Analysis System was utilized to measure wrinkles. Units: arbitrary units

primary_outcome.measure: The change of skin collagen density
primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin collagen density at 4 weeks
primary_outcome.description: DermaLab® USB - 20 MHz High Freq. Ultrasound probe was utilized to scan and analyze skin collagen density. Units: Intensity score

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin texture at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: VISIA Complexion Analysis System was utilized to measure skin texture. Units: arbitrary units

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline skin pores at 4 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: VISIA Complexion Analysis System was utilized to measure skin pores. Units: arbitrary units

intervention.description: consume 1 bottle (50 mL) per day for 28 days
consume 1 bottle (50 mL) per day for 28 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adults aged above 20 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject who is not willing to participate in this study.
- Patients with diseases of the skin, heart, liver, kidney, endocrine and other organs and patients with mental illness (according to medical history).
- Subjects who have known cosmetic, drug or food allergies, difficulty in digestive tract absorption or disorder.
- Female who is pregnant or nursing or planning to become pregnant during the course of the study.
- Received facial laser therapy, chemical peeling or UV overexposure in the past 4 weeks.
- Vegetarian
- Subjects who have large spots (area >3 square centimeter) or abnormal acne.

overall_official.affiliation: Chia Nan University of Pharmacy & Science
